page.title: 01THE REDHILL AREA
page.content:
{REDHILL}lies at the foot of the{SCARP {SLOPE}of the{NORTH DOWNS}in a{CLAY {VALE. }To the south of the town is a{ {SANDSTONE RIDGE.}This complex geology has benefitted several{EXTRACTIVE {INDUSTRIES}which are located here. {REDHILL }developed mainly as a result of the coming of the RAILWAY. The town lies at the junction of the main NORTH/SOUTH, EAST/WEST lines. In the 19th century many railway workers lived in the town. It later grew into a{MARKET TOWN}and finally into a{ {COMMUTER DORMITORY TOWN}
REDHILL has successfully attracted new offices and factories to the area. This has increased local employment so reducing it's dormitory function. The new{QUADRANT SHOPPING CENTRE}will also increase the towns importance as a market centre.
